intro: Campanula cochleariifolia f. ramulosa, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, forming a low, rounded clump. Its unique foliage, with densely pubescent leaves, gives it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
